definition: (music) note/phonetic component of a Chinese character/phonetic symbol/phonogram
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
mark/sign/talisman/to seal/to correspond to/tally/symbol/written charm/to coincide
Mandarin phonetic symbols (MPS), phonetic alphabet for Chinese used esp. in Taiwan, also known colloquially as Bopomofo (after the first four letters of the alphabet:ㄅㄆㄇㄈ)
dieresis/umlaut/diacritical mark separating two adjacent syllables
Mandarin Phonetic Symbols 1 (official name of the phonetic system of writing Chinese used in Taiwan)/Bopomofo/abbr. to 注音一式[zhu4 yin1 yi1 shi4]
pinyin: Guo2 yu3 zhu4 yin1 fu2 hao4 di4 yi1 shi4

sentences.english: Generally, you should try to make gradations in the notes involved.
sentences.chinese: 通常來說，你應該試着將所用到的音符劃分等級。

sentences.english: Did you hear about the violist who bragged that he could play 32nd notes?
sentences.chinese: 你聽說有個中提琴手號稱能拉32分音符嗎？

sentences.english: He was like a taut string; you can play the notes from time to time.
sentences.chinese: 他像是一根繃緊的弦，時不時可以彈奏出音符。

sentences.english: One NOTE is a treble clef.
Rough- hewn , angular notes, like stones in the wall of a churchyard.
sentences.chinese: 粗獷，生硬的音符，像墓地圍牆上的石頭般。

sentences.english: Then try the 7D again, you may find that you can play it more easily.
sentences.chinese: 然後再試着吹奏7D音符，你會發現已經容易多了。

sentences.english: I like the small electric blue notes of grape hyacinths.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡葡萄風信子的小的電的憂鬱音符。

sentences.english: A voice played the notes inside her.
sentences.chinese: 在她的心裏，有一個聲音在彈奏着音符。

sentences.english: Here, you can use notes to make sounds.
sentences.chinese: 這個程序你可以用音符寫曲子。

sentences.english: Technology-the combination of curves and lines is like notes struck, demonstrating the concepts of aesthetics.
sentences.chinese: 曲線與平滑的結合，像律動的音符，詮釋着美的概念。

sentences.english: Singers and instrumentalists have to be able to get every note perfectly in tune.
sentences.chinese: 歌手和樂器演奏者必須使所有的音符完全相同協調。

sentences.english: Music the first note of a diatonic scale.
sentences.chinese: 全音階中的第一個音符。

sentences.english: You put our lives each note, all into the world most beautiful colors.
sentences.chinese: 您把我們生命的每一個音符，都鍍成世界最美的顏色。

sentences.english: It is perhaps easier to play some notes on the Chromatic than it is on the 10 hole harmonica.
sentences.chinese: 也許在半音階口琴上更容易去吹奏某些音符。

sentences.english: Sometimes the notes would dance off the page becoming faster and faster and more effervescent.
sentences.chinese: 有時，音符會離開紙頁，變得越來越快，甚至飛舞。

sentences.english: The singer dwelt on a note where he shouldn't have done so.
sentences.chinese: 歌唱者不恰當地把一個音符拖長了。
